content: Past Discussion: Africans at 2024 Paris Olympics Quote from: Hewlet on July 26, 2024, 06:37:29 AMThe Olympics games is up and running with African football teams heavily represented. For the men's category we have representatives of the African teams which are;1. Guinea, 2. Morocco 3. Egypt 4. MaliWhile for the female category we have two African teams;1. Nigeria2. Zambia.From the results of the first leg played at the group stage,  Guinea which is in the group comprising of France, New Zealand and USA lost her first match and is currently at third place in the group A while  while Morocco won against Argentina and secured all three point standing on the second place of the group B, Egypt had a goales draw against the Dominican Republic which they should have made effort to win considering that Spain is in same group with them while mali had a 1:1 draw against Israel at group D.It's a fair start for the male African team and it's good that some of the teams are doing well and are at the top of their respective groups. For the female teams, it appears as though they are both at the group of death with both teams currently lying bottom of thier respective group's. Zambia suffered a 3:0 defeat  in favour of the USA while the Nigerian supa falcons lost 1 nill against Brazil and still have Spain and Japan upfront. Parent Discussion:  World Cup qualifiers - CAF Don't you just hate it when the international break comes and as an African, you feel left out because there isn't a discussion thread for we Africans to discuss international Sport/football tournaments like our counterparts. Well that feeling should be a thing of the past as this thread will serve as a dedicated hangout joint for discussion by all forum users (both Africans and foreigners) interested in Africans in sport.This thread will be updated with everything Africa Sport/football worth discussing, each tournaments, round fixtures, table standing etc. Feel free to drop your prediction on table toppers, match winners and discussion as any tournament progresses etc.Ps: Previous thread has been locked and a self moderated thread was created to moderate spam and off topic discussion.

comments.body: Quote from: CryptopreneurBrainboss on January 01, 2023, 12:51:40 PM Tottenham Hotspur have reportedly launched an offer for Barcelona forward Franck Kessie.Source: https://www.goal.com/en-ng/news/live/african-transfer-news-and-rumours-live-psg-enter-race-to-sign-osimhen-next-summer/blt6f371b16a0d28ce6I think it would be a good move for Franck Kessie to join Tottenham. His abilities are being wasted at Barcelona. He's a very good CM that thrives in the double-pivot system. He's the kind of player Conte likes (physical and technical). When people talk about African players they focus mainly on the physicality of the player which should not be so, especially with Kessie. He's more technical than he is physical. I watched him a lot when he was in Milan and he's a very good midfielder. He can help dictate the game. He knows how to win the ball back and has the technicality needed to deal with the ball when he wins it back. Tottenham would be a good move for him since he not getting any playing time in a Barca anyway.

comments.body: QuoteAboubakar has seen his Al-Nassr contract CANCELLED, could he be on his way to Manchester united or which clubs do you think will be favorable the hm?The Cameroonian will depart the club to make way for Ronaldo as Saudi league rules state that clubs can only register up to eight foreign players per squad. Do you think he should make the move or not then wait for another team to pick interest in him?Personally I think he doesn't fit Erik ten Hag project most especially as he's now old and that's the same problem Ronaldo was facing which is lack of speed to help In their counter attack strategy.
